intro: Actinocephalus claussenianus, commonly known as the Cape fennel, is a perennial herb native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features finely divided, feathery leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in umbels. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to dry, sandy soils. Its medicinal properties have also been explored in traditional herbal practices.
